instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: Hi, i have and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-2936 Board with green light at the charger.But <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts i even change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and still same problem.What do you recommend? Please see my attachment for the rail i have checked.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: What is the resistance to ground on F7040? What is the resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? What is the resistance between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? 1.7v is magic number for short to ground or bad charger side current sensing(pins 27/28)

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: thanks for your reply  on f7040  to ground the resisitance in diode mode 0.423   current sensing (pins 27/28) is 16.31v   and pin 17/18 i get 1.4v

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 not voltage.

threads.message: is this short to ground  i changed the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> twice and same issue.

threads.message: pin 27/28 and i get  diode mode 0.658    on pin 17/18  i get diode mode 0.001  i understand now

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: No you don't understand, I'm asking for resistance not diode mode. But diode mode provided enough info here. Pin 27/28 should have 20 Ohms between them. So you either have a bad <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 or a bad trace in that circuit.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: I need a value, wait for it to stabilize. Anything over 22 Ohms will means bad <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 or corroded trace.

threads.message: okay thanks let me check

threads.title: [SOLVED] <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2936  low volatage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.6volts
threads.message: I have no idea what you mean. Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 if they are 10 ohm and then check all traces from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> to <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
